title: TikTok Launches $200 Million Fund To Finance Up-And-Coming Stars
author: Abram Brown

title: AI 50: America’s Most Promising Artificial Intelligence Companies
author: Alan Ohnsman

title: Tesla’s First Four-Quarter Profit Streak Ensures Fat Payout For Musk And S&P 500 Inclusion
author: Alan Ohnsman

title: Nikola Building $600 Million Plant In Arizona Desert To Get Hydrogen Big Rigs Rolling By 2023
author: Alan Ohnsman

title: Sen. Tom Cotton Introduces Bill To Prevent Schools From Teaching 1619 Project
description: Conservatives have long railed against the New York Times Magazine project re-examining America’s legacy of slavery.
author: Andrew Solender

title: Google Just Upped Its E-Commerce Game To Attract More Sellers. It’s Not Enough To Compete With Amazon.
description: Google said it would drop commission fees for merchants that participate in its Buy on Google program.
author: Andria Cheng

title: On National Tequila Day Go Beyond The Margarita
description: You hardly need any 'holiday' for an excuse. Here are some easy recipes for refreshing cocktails.
author: Brad Japhe

title: U.S. Mint Asks Americans To Use More Change To Help Ease Coin Shortage
description: Time to break open that piggy bank.
author: Carlie Porterfield

title: America’s Best Sports Cities 2020
author: Christina Settimi

title: Coronavirus Runs Rampant In Virginia ICE Detention Facility
description: The number of infected detainees in the Farmville detention center jumped from 49 to 268 in less than a month.
author: Daniel Cassady

title: India Gets Desperate For Mountain Fighters, Sends Navy MiGs North
description: The Indian Navy plans to deploy some of its extra MiG-29 carrier-borne fighters to the Himalayas to reinforce air force jets flying patrols over a disputed region bordering China.
author: David Axe

title: Businesses Can Tackle Air Pollution While Recovering From COVID-19
description: Global Action Plan offers businesses free support as they commit to improving air quality, cutting emissions and cleaning up the air for communities across the UK.
author: Emanuela Barbiroglio

title: A Human Rights Body Calls Upon States To Take Legal Actions Against China For Its Atrocities Against Uighur Muslims
description: On July 22, 2020, the Bar Human Rights Committee, international human rights arm of the Bar of England and Wales, published a briefing paper “Responsibility of States under International Law to Uighurs and other Turkic Muslims in Xinjiang, China” mapping the avenues for legal recourse.
author: Ewelina U. Ochab

title: Mesut Ozil And Kieran Tierney Prove The Difference Between Old And New Arsenal
description: The Scottish left back has become the embodiment of what the new Arsenal manager wants to achieve at the Emirates Stadium.
author: Graham Ruthven

title: BTS Dominates The World Albums Chart By Controlling Half Of The Entire Ranking
description: Including one BTS member's solo release, the group grabs eight of the 15 spots on the World Albums chart this frame.
author: Hugh McIntyre

title: Chris Frantz Of Talking Heads On The Marriage Of Music And Art, Life With Tina Weymouth And New Book Remain In Love
description: Co-founding Talking Heads drummer and Rock and Roll Hall of Famer Chris Frantz talks about his new book Remain in Love, the legacy of Talking Heads, life alongside wife Tina Weymouth in both Talking Heads and Tom Tom Club and often acrimonious dealings with singer David Byrne.
author: Jim Ryan

title: Millions Of School Children To Get Distance Learning Boost Via Expanded Verizon Program
description: Access to reliable internet connectivity surfaced as a problem during the last school year, especially in lower-income and more rural districts, when the coronavirus forced nearly all public school students to learn from home.
author: Karen Robinson-Jacobs

title: The Best Tequila Food Pairings To Try Right Now
description: There’s more to tequila than shots in a dive bar. So Nicholas Soglanich, the former professional golfer behind The Tequila Wanderer, talked about how to properly pair the spirit with unconventional dishes that enhance and complement.
author: Karla Alindahao

title: Newly Minted Charlotte FC Should Follow Atlanta United’s Blueprint For Expansion Success
author: Kellen Becoats

title: Europe’s Airports Slam ‘One-Sided’ Aid To Airlines And Call For Arrival Duty-Free Sales
description: Airports association ACI Europe is hoping that if passengers can shop on arrival they will bring in some badly-needed extra revenue in the wake of almost one billion lost travelers this year to date.
author: Kevin Rozario

title: The Crazy Scenarios Of MLB’s Newly Expanded 16-Team Postseason
description: MLB and the MLBPA reached an agreement just hours before the start of the pandemic-shortened regular season that will see the number of playoff teams jump from 10 to 16. Here are the details and crazy scenarios.
author: Maury Brown

title: China’s ‘Wolf Warrior’ Tactics Mixed With Trump’s Jungle Diplomacy Ratchets Up Risk Of Conflict
description: If leaders on either side of the Pacific had a long-term strategy of working together, it’s been thrown out in favor of confrontation.
author: Mark L. Clifford

title: China Makes Another Enemy? Now Chinese Warships Are Confronting The Australian Navy
description: Chinese warships have confronted Australian Navy vessels in the South China Sea, raising tensions in already volatile region.
author: Michael Peck

title: Parking Tickets Covered By Eighth Amendment’s Ban On Excessive Fines, Federal Court Rules
description: “This right to be free from excessive governmental fines is not a relic relegated to the period of parchments and parliaments, but rather it remains a crucial bulwark against government abuse.”
author: Nick Sibilla

title: ‘Mulan’ Delayed Indefinitely, ‘Avatar’ And ‘Star Wars’ Pushed Back A Year
description: Movie theater closures and production delays have thrown the film industry into chaos
author: Rachel Sandler

title: Updated CDC Guidelines Strongly Favor Reopening Schools
description: Many of the largest school districts have already opted to go fully online in the fall.
author: Rachel Sandler

title: Dark Days For Italy’s Historic Murano Glass Industry
description: Italy’s Murano glass industry had already been struggling before lockdown, but the coronavirus emergency may mean some factories close their doors for good.
author: Rebecca Ann Hughes

title: New Potential Advances In Treating Psoriasis: A Skin Condition That Affects 125+ Million People
description: Although psoriasis has been a well-recognized skin condition for many years, there has been significant progress over the last decade on effective therapeutic models and treatment modalities for this autoimmune condition.
author: Sai Balasubramanian, J.D.

title: NFL Should Hold 2020 Coronavirus Season In Two California Bubbles
description: Bubbles are working for the NBA and MLS. The NFL should follow the NHL's lead and have one bubble for each conference in Northern and Southern California.
author: Shlomo Sprung

title: What Congress Should And Should Not Do On Health Care
description: Congress should codify the Trump administration’s price transparency rules, prohibit balance billing, expand health savings accounts (HSAs), and provide states with greater Medicaid flexibility. Congress should not subsidize COBRA or the ACA, and Congress should not provide a state bailout.
author: Brian Blase

title: Report: Trump To Sign Executive Orders Aimed At Lowering Prescription Drug Costs
description: Trump promised to tackle the problem when campaigning for the presidency back in 2016.
author: Tommy Beer
